ICE Lab (Innovation Center of Excellence Lab) on CGI:n suomenlaajuinen innovaatio- ja kokeilukeskus, jossa tehdään yhteistyötä eri asiakkaiden, sidosryhmien ja yliopistojen kanssa, sekä kehitetään uusia ratkaisuja, joissa hyödynnetään pilviteknologioita, analytiikkaa, tekoälyä, automaatiota ja designia.Toivottu osaaminenRatkaisuarkkitehdilta toivomme vahvaa osaamista pilviteknologioista, ohjelmistokehityksestä ja projektinhallinnasta. Ratkaisuarkkitehdin tulee olla kyvykäs johtamaan tiimiä ja kommunikoimaan tehokkaasti asiakkaiden kanssa varmistaakseen, että projekti etenee suunnitelmien mukaan. Toivomme innovatiivisuutta ja valmiutta haastaa vakiintuneita toimintamalleja.Toivomme sinulta vankkaa osaamista modernien arkkitehtuurien, devauksen ja Agile-menetelmien parista. Tämä tehtävä vaatii vahvaa osaamista pilviteknologioista jollain seuraavista alustoista: Azure, AWS tai GCP, mutta myös kykyä viestiä teknisiä asioita selkeästi.Aikaisempi kokemus AI -toteutuksista on eduksi mutta ei välttämätöntä. Tärkeintä on vahva ohjelmistotekniikan osaaminen ja kiinnostus soveltaa valmiita AI -malleja ja puolivalmisteita sekä ohjelmistojen kehityksessä että osana ratkaisuja.Eduksi katsotaan osaaminen• AI-perusteista ja neuroverkoista• ChatGPT ja muut generatiiviset AI-mallit• AI avusteinen ohjelmistokehitys• kokemusta LLM-sovelluskehyksistä, kuten Langchainista.Tiimimme on rento ja avoin, ja meillä pääset työskentelemään moderneilla teknologiolla ja huippuluokan työkaluilla. Arvostamme työntekijöidemme kehittymis- ja koulutusmahdollisuuksia, joten voit odottaa saavasi meiltä tukea urapolullesi. Voit tutustua näkemyksiimme pinnalla olevista aiheista (kuten Green Coding ja ChatGTP) kuuntelemalla pilvipodiaMeille viihtymisesi on tärkeää ja työskentely kanssamme on joustavaa. Töitä voit tehdä kaikkialta Suomesta.Meillä CGI:llä…… olet member.Tarjoamme sinulle paitsi työn, jossa voit kehittyä haluamaasi suuntaan, myös mahdollisuuden omistaa yhtiön osakkeita. Koska yli 80 prosenttia henkilöstöstämme on myös omistajia, kutsumme henkilöstöämme membereiksi. Membereinä pääsemme nauttimaan CGI:n taloudellisesta menestyksestä ja rakentamaan toiveidemme mukaista yhtiötä.… saat olla sellainen kuin olet.Meitä on 3 700 ympäri Suomen ja meille on tärkeää, että jokainen meistä saa olla työpaikalla oma itsensä. Monimuotoiset tiimimme määrittelevät itse, millaiset joustavat työnteon tavat niille parhaiten sopivat. Meillä työ myös joustaa, kun elämäntilanne sitä vaatii.… sinusta pidetään huolta.Meille CGI:n membereille on tärkeää, että tuemme ja autamme aina toisiamme. Et ole koskaan yksin: tuhansista huippuasiantuntijoistamme löytyy aina joku, johon tukeutua. Ja tarjoamme tietysti myös laajan valikoiman henkilöstöetuja, jotka auttavat sinua voimaan paremmin.… innostut työstäsi – yhä uudelleen.Meillä viihdytään pitkään, koska kokoisessamme talossa on tarjolla aina uusia uramahdollisuuksia ja niihin siirtyminen on tehty helpoksi. Kun kaipaat vaihtelua, voit ottaa haltuun uuden teknologian, toimialan tai asiakkuuden – ja kun kaipaat työltä joustoa uudessa elämäntilanteessa, sekin järjestyy. Tule meille rakentamaan itsesi näköinen ura!Kiinnostuitko?Hienoa! Seuraavaksi kuulisimme mielellämme lisää sinusta ja osaamisestasi! Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa Matti Koljonen, puhelimitse +358 40 7538287.Voit hakea tehtävää rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta osoitteessa www.cgi.fi/ura.Viimeinen hakupäivä on 21.5.2023. Käymme hakemuksia läpi kuitenkin jo hakuaikana ja etenemme rekrytointiprosessissa heti sopivan kandidaatin löydyttyä – hakemus kannattaa siis lähettää vaikka heti!Perusmuotoinen turvallisuusselvitys tullaan tekemään tehtävän niin vaatiessa.

Are you our next engineer of change?This is for you who wants to have a real impact on creating a healthier planet for our children every day. With Neste, you will work for the world's leading producer of sustainable aviation fuel, renewable diesel, and more sustainable feedstocks for the polymers and chemicals industry. Let’s create transformation for a sustainable future together.We are looking for youSenior Front End Software Engineerto our Products & Tools team in NAPCON.You'll be working with two of our user interface products (details further down) and also make proof-of-concept applications occasionally. Keys to success in this role Your technical background at a minimum levelJavaScript/TypeScript expertiseVery experienced in Vue 3/Vite and current extended CSS technologies (Bootstrap and jQuery don't qualify)You know your way around React.You think a11y is a top priority, as well as code sustainability.You know the difference between a serif and sans-serif and can fine-tune pixels.You know how to commit.Fluency in both written and spoken EnglishExcellent communication and collaboration skillsEquivalent to 4+ years of software development experience (but even more importantly, a willingness to dig deep into code, learn it, improve it, and get to work)Bonus ifYou're familiar with the basics of NoSQL and SQLYou know how to split and share work between back-end and front-end teamsYou feel warm and fuzzy when you think about conventional commits, READMEs, and self-documenting codeYou effectively sweep up your code smellsYou consider testing, quality assurance, and documentation to be essential aspects of software developmentOther buzzwords that aren’t a requirement but will make you a unicorn are Scrum/agile, Pixi.js, Sass, Tailwind, Jira/Bitbucket, gamification, chemical engineering, and Grafana.What we’ll be looking for in your applicationA public portfolio (like GitHub) with sample projects, intriguing READMEs, and self-documenting codePersonality and valuesWhy you're passionate about front-end engineering, and what you're looking to learn and experienceYou’ll be a good fit for this role ifYou're proactive and self-leading, and your values align with Neste's: we care, cooperate, and have courage.You care about release processes and software testing and think changelogs serve a purpose.You support junior team members in their engineering efforts, collaborate cross-team, and are communicative.You listen to future business needs, consider the impact and consequences of implementations and work towards minimizing technical debt. More about the job Your role in our teamYou'll join our Products & Tools unit and work as a Front End Engineer in one of our scrum teams. We're a team of 30, including software engineers, product managers, and architects.Your location can be Turku (Kupittaa), Espoo (Keilaniemi), or Kilpilahti (Porvoo), but our Neste Smart Work way of working allows hybrid and flexible remote work opportunities (Finland-based).You will develop web-based user interface applications for advanced process control systems, analytics dashboards, and gamified simulator training.Our product categories are Improve, Train, and Understand. We provide digital tools to improve processes, train operators, and analyze data. Companies globally use our applications to ensure efficient production plan performance.In addition, we work with technologies like .NET, C#, SQL databases, and Azure/GCP. Visit www.napconsuite.com for more information about our product and service offering.NAPCON, part of Neste, develops software products and solutions to improve process industry plant safety, sustainability, productivity, and quality. We're about 100 engineering professionals with different backgrounds, working with software, chemical engineering, security, automation, and data analysis.Our organization model is agile and lean. We work closely with our customers and other NAPCON teams, including customer relations and product management. Together with you and your expertise, we can make an impact today and keep our promises for tomorrow. Let’s get you started We look forward to receiving your CV and optional cover letter (with a salary request) by May 12, 2023. Applications will be reviewed during the application period, so don’t wait too long.If you have questions regarding the process or the position, please get in touch with hiring manager Jenni Pulli at jenni.pulli@neste.com. Note! We're not looking to hire consultants, so no sales; thank you.The recruitment process will include interviews and a possible aptitude assessment. The first interviews are preliminarily scheduled for weeks 20-21. The person selected for the position must pass a health examination, including a drug test. A security clearance is obtained with their consent. Reasons to join Real impact right now. We work in an inspiring and evolving business environment, where everything we do serves one purpose: to create a healthier planet for our children. To drive a growing impact as a global leader in renewable and circular solutions we live by our values every day; we care, we have courage, we cooperate.Safety and caring. We value safety always and everywhere. We want our work to feel good and do good. At Neste, we nurture a culture where everyone is welcome and feels safe, respected and encouraged to be their unique true selves.Exciting growth. Transformation brings new possibilities and fosters our courage and curiosity. As a global growing company we support personal development and offer versatile learning and career opportunities. Collaboration is the key, and we believe in flexible, smart ways of working.In addition we offer extensive support for healthcare and leisure time activities including health insurance fund, subventioned lunch and exercise possibilities, personnel clubs and holiday home weeks at a special price.About NesteNeste creates solutions for combating climate change and accelerating a shift to a circular economy. With over 75 years of expertise, we are the world’s leading producer of sustainable aviation fuel and renewable diesel and a forerunner in developing renewable and circular feedstock solutions for polymers and chemicals. We have set aspirational targets for climate, biodiversity, human rights, as well as our supply chain and raw materials. Together with our partners we are aiming at a carbon neutral and nature positive value chain by 2040. Our success is created by 5,400 professionals working in 16 countries. Read more: neste.com . Watch the Neste story here .

With Neste, you will work for the world's leading producer of sustainable aviation fuel, renewable diesel, and more sustainable feedstocks for the polymers and chemicals industry. Keys to success in this role Your technical background at a minimum levelJavaScript/TypeScript expertiseVery experienced in Vue 3/Vite and current extended CSS technologies (Bootstrap and jQuery don't qualify)You know your way around React.You think a11y is a top priority, as well as code sustainability.You know the difference between a serif and sans-serif and can fine-tune pixels.You know how to commit.Fluency in both written and spoken EnglishExcellent communication and collaboration skillsEquivalent to 4+ years of software development experience (but even more importantly, a willingness to dig deep into code, learn it, improve it, and get to work)Bonus ifYou're familiar with the basics of NoSQL and SQLYou know how to split and share work between back-end and front-end teamsYou feel warm and fuzzy when you think about conventional commits, READMEs, and self-documenting codeYou effectively sweep up your code smellsYou consider testing, quality assurance, and documentation to be essential aspects of software developmentOther buzzwords that aren’t a requirement but will make you a unicorn are Scrum/agile, Pixi.js, Sass, Tailwind, Jira/Bitbucket, gamification, chemical engineering, and Grafana.What we’ll be looking for in your applicationA public portfolio (like GitHub) with sample projects, intriguing READMEs, and self-documenting codePersonality and valuesWhy you're passionate about front-end engineering, and what you're looking to learn and experienceYou’ll be a good fit for this role ifYou're proactive and self-leading, and your values align with Neste's: we care, cooperate, and have courage.You care about release processes and software testing and think changelogs serve a purpose.You support junior team members in their engineering efforts, collaborate cross-team, and are communicative.You listen to future business needs, consider the impact and consequences of implementations and work towards minimizing technical debt. More about the job Your role in our teamYou'll join our Products & Tools unit and work as a Front End Engineer in one of our scrum teams. We're a team of 30, including software engineers, product managers, and architects.Your location can be Turku (Kupittaa), Espoo (Keilaniemi), or Kilpilahti (Porvoo), but our Neste Smart Work way of working allows hybrid and flexible remote work opportunities (Finland-based).You will develop web-based user interface applications for advanced process control systems, analytics dashboards, and gamified simulator training.Our product categories are Improve, Train, and Understand. We provide digital tools to improve processes, train operators, and analyze data. Companies globally use our applications to ensure efficient production plan performance.In addition, we work with technologies like .NET, C#, SQL databases, and Azure/GCP. Collaboration is the key, and we believe in flexible, smart ways of working.In addition we offer extensive support for healthcare and leisure time activities including health insurance fund, subventioned lunch and exercise possibilities, personnel clubs and holiday home weeks at a special price.About NesteNeste creates solutions for combating climate change and accelerating a shift to a circular economy. With over 75 years of expertise, we are the world’s leading producer of sustainable aviation fuel and renewable diesel and a forerunner in developing renewable and circular feedstock solutions for polymers and chemicals. Together with our partners we are aiming at a carbon neutral and nature positive value chain by 2040. Our success is created by 5,400 professionals working in 16 countries. Read more: neste.com.

As one of Huawei’s three business groups, Huawei Consumer BG is the leader of the all-scenario AI life. It covers smartphones, PC and tablets, wearables, mobile broadband devices, family devices and device cloud services. Huawei Consumer BG is dedicated to delivering the latest technologies to consumers and sharing the happiness of technological advances with more people around the world. Walk the walk and make dreams come true.We are currently looking for a talented Multi-Modal Video Search Researcher to research and develop next-generation multimodal video search technologies for Huawei Finland Research Center, Cloud R&D. You will join a close-knit team of highly accomplished researchers and research engineers to deliver cutting-edge technologies that impact millions of users. The responsibility involves designing, implementing, and optimizing advanced AI models towards various impactful applicational domains, including but not limited to natural language processing and computer vision applied to multi-modal information and video retrieval. As a member of this team, you will be tackling meaningful technical problems together with one of the world's most innovative product development teams. You will have the opportunity of transferring your deep understanding of the domain knowledge and your engineering skills into real solutions in the next generation of Huawei products. RequirementsMandatory:Ph.D. (or MSc with 4+ years’ experience) in topics such as Information or Video Retrieval/Search, (Large) Language Models, Vector Search, Multimodal Machine Learning with Vision and Language, or any other closely related domainExperienced with at least one common Deep Learning framework, e.g., PyTorch, TensorflowStrong expertise in at least one of the following areas: 1. Computer Vision, 2. Natural Language Processing (Transformers), 3. Information, Image, or Video RetrievalSolid programming skills with PythonFluent in EnglishAdditional Skills/Experiences (nice to have):Experience working with large-scale dataset construction and model training as well as model evaluationProven records in top-tier publications, e.g., NeurIPS, SIGIR, ECIR, CIKM, TPAMI, CVPR, ICCV, ACL, EMNLP, etc.Experience in project managementKnowledge of Spanish or Arabic is a plus Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home, and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.We offer a position in a forward-looking industrial research team with a solid track record in both innovation and publication, as well as delivering its result as factual contributions to on-the-market devices. Working at Huawei in an international atmosphere is fun, and the opportunity to develop your skills and competencies is endless. Are you ready for the challenge?

Huawei’s Consumer Business Group is growing extremely fast, and our global ecosystem, namely Huawei Mobile Services (https://huaweimobileservices.com/), is serving hundreds of millions of users. We believe in creating safe, privacy-friendly with great user experience and quality products for our consumers. We are looking for an experienced, creative, and motivated (Senior or Principal level) Researcher specializing in NLP & Knowledge Graph to address challenges in content security and build good detection capabilities to ensure safe content is presented to users.Main responsibilities:Participate in defining the content policy and research roadmap in the field of content security.Research in content security to design and build state-of-the-art solutions/tools for global abuse detection and prevention systems, sentiment analysis, reducing bias, and improving the explainability of the solution.Continuous research and evaluation of emerging technologies, staying current on published state-of-the-art ML methods, technologies, and applications.Explore research opportunities and establish research collaboration with academia.RequirementsSounds like a match for your career aspiration? Please apply if you have the following:Academic and/or industrial proven success in the area of NLP and Computer Vision/Machine Learning applied to security, multilinguals NLP.Motivated in hands-on research and use of Deep Learning concepts and technologies.Experience with some of the following concepts: multilingual text analysis, Transformers for NLP, knowledge representation, and knowledge graphs.Proven success in addressing content security problems on abusive content, hate speech, and fake content detection is a big plus.Experience in bias detection and prevention, explainable AI is a plus.Good knowledge of Python and hands-on experience with some NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, and Keras.Experience with various public cloud environments and technologies is a plus.Ph.D. in AI/ML/NLP computer science, maths, statistics, computational linguistics, or equivalent experience.LocationThis position is located at our R&D office in Ruoholahti, Helsinki, Finland. We will start interviews immediately when suitable candidates are found, so do not hesitate to send in your application too long!

Huawei’s vision is to enhance the lives of humanity and improve the environment by building a fully connected and intelligent world. At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward.This is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic Leader eager to build a team to shape the technologies of the future with us. We are looking for a passionate Chief Scientist with a solid track record of solving hard problems, advancing state-of-the-art, and delivering AI-driven products, and demonstrated passion for ground-breaking research that could be scaled to production environment with an emphasis on Computer Vision, Visual Multimodal. Business department:HUAWEI CLOUD EI Service Product Dept. More information on Huawei Enterprise can be found in this link https://e.huawei.com/en/about/huawei-enterprise Business direction:Define the research agenda and lead the next generation research and technology incubation, to create AI-driven, cutting-edge technologies for the HUAWEI CLOUD Robust Large Multi-modal Model. Job Responsibilities:Develop long-term competitiveness of the visual multi-modal algorithm of HUAWEI CLOUD, formulate mid- and long-term strategies and lead the research team to conduct innovative research and technology prototype development to create the #1 solution in the industry.Take charge of technical planning for the next two to five to ten years, understand customers' business requirements and pain points, and propose new key research direction, agenda, and topics.Responsible for disrupting technology innovation and breakthroughs in the computer vision field.Recruit and develop a world-class research team in Computer Vision, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Multimodal, and Generative AI.Lead the formulation of important standards that affect technological development in Multimodal and Generative AI; Responsible for key technology research and architecture design.Develop the R&D capabilities of the team, and guide the work of the R&D team through workshops, reviews, or consultancy.Grasp the development trend of the computer vision field, and establish strategic partnerships by developing advanced technology cooperation with well-known universities and the industry partners.Requirements:At least 10+ years of innovative computer vision research experience, building and deploying groundbreaking ML/CV solutions at scale.Pioneering novel methods and neural networks that revolutionized machine learning, computer vision or AI field or revolutionized the industry is a big bonus.International awards in the field of AI/ML/CV and highly recognized by experts of the same field.Strong core competency in mathematics and AI, and proficient in one or more technologies such as deep learning, Generative AI, Multimodal AI, Large Language Model, and image-text multi-modal.Strong knowledge and experience in image, language, and multi-modal pre-training models, neural network architecture and algorithm design.Strong publication record in major CV/AI conferences i.e., CVPR/ICCV/ECCV/NeurIPS/ ICLR/ICML/IJCVGood teamwork, enjoy working with multi-cultures team, passionate in challenging the status quo.Ph.D. in Computer Science, Deep Learning, Machine Learning or other related fields.If you are passionate about creating new innovations in the field of Computer Vision, then this role is what you are looking for.

As one of Huawei’s three business groups, Huawei Consumer BG is the leader of the all-scenario AI life. It covers smartphones, PC and tablets, wearables, mobile broadband devices, family devices and device cloud services. Huawei Consumer BG is dedicated to delivering the latest technologies to consumers and sharing the happiness of technological advances with more people around the world. Walk the walk and make dreams come true.We are currently looking for a talented Multi-Modal Video Search Researcher to research and develop next-generation multimodal video search technologies for Huawei Finland Research Center, Cloud R&D. You will join a close-knit team of highly accomplished researchers and research engineers to deliver cutting-edge technologies that impact millions of users. The responsibility involves designing, implementing, and optimizing advanced AI models towards various impactful applicational domains, including but not limited to natural language processing and computer vision applied to multi-modal information and video retrieval. As a member of this team, you will be tackling meaningful technical problems together with one of the world's most innovative product development teams. You will have the opportunity of transferring your deep understanding of the domain knowledge and your engineering skills into real solutions in the next generation of Huawei products. RequirementsMandatory:Ph.D. (or MSc with 4+ years’ experience) in topics such as Information or Video Retrieval/Search, (Large) Language Models, Vector Search, Multimodal Machine Learning with Vision and Language, or any other closely related domainExperienced with at least one common Deep Learning framework, e.g., PyTorch, TensorflowStrong expertise in at least one of the following areas: 1. Computer Vision, 2. Natural Language Processing (Transformers), 3. Information, Image, or Video RetrievalSolid programming skills with PythonFluent in EnglishAdditional Skills/Experiences (nice to have):Experience working with large-scale dataset construction and model training as well as model evaluationProven records in top-tier publications, e.g., NeurIPS, SIGIR, ECIR, CIKM, TPAMI, CVPR, ICCV, ACL, EMNLP, etc.Experience in project managementKnowledge of Spanish or Arabic is a plus Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home, and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.We offer a position in a forward-looking industrial research team with a solid track record in both innovation and publication, as well as delivering its result as factual contributions to on-the-market devices. Working at Huawei in an international atmosphere is fun, and the opportunity to develop your skills and competencies is endless. Are you ready for the challenge?

Huawei’s Consumer Business Group is growing extremely fast, and our global ecosystem, namely Huawei Mobile Services (https://huaweimobileservices.com/), is serving hundreds of millions of users. We believe in creating safe, privacy-friendly with great user experience and quality products for our consumers. We are looking for an experienced, creative, and motivated (Senior or Principal level) Researcher specializing in NLP & Knowledge Graph to address challenges in content security and build good detection capabilities to ensure safe content is presented to users.Main responsibilities:Participate in defining the content policy and research roadmap in the field of content security.Research in content security to design and build state-of-the-art solutions/tools for global abuse detection and prevention systems, sentiment analysis, reducing bias, and improving the explainability of the solution.Continuous research and evaluation of emerging technologies, staying current on published state-of-the-art ML methods, technologies, and applications.Explore research opportunities and establish research collaboration with academia.RequirementsSounds like a match for your career aspiration? Please apply if you have the following:Academic and/or industrial proven success in the area of NLP and Computer Vision/Machine Learning applied to security, multilinguals NLP.Motivated in hands-on research and use of Deep Learning concepts and technologies.Experience with some of the following concepts: multilingual text analysis, Transformers for NLP, knowledge representation, and knowledge graphs.Proven success in addressing content security problems on abusive content, hate speech, and fake content detection is a big plus.Experience in bias detection and prevention, explainable AI is a plus.Good knowledge of Python and hands-on experience with some NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, and Keras.Experience with various public cloud environments and technologies is a plus.Ph.D. in AI/ML/NLP computer science, maths, statistics, computational linguistics, or equivalent experience.LocationThis position is located at our R&D office in Ruoholahti, Helsinki, Finland. We will start interviews immediately when suitable candidates are found, so do not hesitate to send in your application too long!

As one of Huawei’s three business groups, Huawei Consumer BG is the leader of the all-scenario AI life. It covers smartphones, PC and tablets, wearables, mobile broadband devices, family devices and device cloud services. Huawei Consumer BG is dedicated to delivering the latest technologies to consumers and sharing the happiness of technological advances with more people around the world. Walk the walk and make dreams come true.We are currently looking for a talented Multi-Modal Video Search Researcher to research and develop next-generation multimodal video search technologies for Huawei Finland Research Center, Cloud R&D. You will join a close-knit team of highly accomplished researchers and research engineers to deliver cutting-edge technologies that impact millions of users. The responsibility involves designing, implementing, and optimizing advanced AI models towards various impactful applicational domains, including but not limited to natural language processing and computer vision applied to multi-modal information and video retrieval. As a member of this team, you will be tackling meaningful technical problems together with one of the world's most innovative product development teams. You will have the opportunity of transferring your deep understanding of the domain knowledge and your engineering skills into real solutions in the next generation of Huawei products. RequirementsMandatory:Ph.D. (or MSc with 4+ years’ experience) in topics such as Information or Video Retrieval/Search, (Large) Language Models, Vector Search, Multimodal Machine Learning with Vision and Language, or any other closely related domainExperienced with at least one common Deep Learning framework, e.g., PyTorch, TensorflowStrong expertise in at least one of the following areas: 1. Computer Vision, 2. Natural Language Processing (Transformers), 3. Information, Image, or Video RetrievalSolid programming skills with PythonFluent in EnglishAdditional Skills/Experiences (nice to have):Experience working with large-scale dataset construction and model training as well as model evaluationProven records in top-tier publications, e.g., NeurIPS, SIGIR, ECIR, CIKM, TPAMI, CVPR, ICCV, ACL, EMNLP, etc.Experience in project managementKnowledge of Spanish or Arabic is a plus Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home, and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.We offer a position in a forward-looking industrial research team with a solid track record in both innovation and publication, as well as delivering its result as factual contributions to on-the-market devices. Working at Huawei in an international atmosphere is fun, and the opportunity to develop your skills and competencies is endless. Are you ready for the challenge?

Huawei’s Consumer Business Group is growing extremely fast, and our global ecosystem, namely Huawei Mobile Services (https://huaweimobileservices.com/), is serving hundreds of millions of users. We believe in creating safe, privacy-friendly with great user experience and quality products for our consumers. We are looking for an experienced, creative, and motivated (Senior or Principal level) Researcher specializing in NLP & Knowledge Graph to address challenges in content security and build good detection capabilities to ensure safe content is presented to users.Main responsibilities:Participate in defining the content policy and research roadmap in the field of content security.Research in content security to design and build state-of-the-art solutions/tools for global abuse detection and prevention systems, sentiment analysis, reducing bias, and improving the explainability of the solution.Continuous research and evaluation of emerging technologies, staying current on published state-of-the-art ML methods, technologies, and applications.Explore research opportunities and establish research collaboration with academia.RequirementsSounds like a match for your career aspiration? Please apply if you have the following:Academic and/or industrial proven success in the area of NLP and Computer Vision/Machine Learning applied to security, multilinguals NLP.Motivated in hands-on research and use of Deep Learning concepts and technologies.Experience with some of the following concepts: multilingual text analysis, Transformers for NLP, knowledge representation, and knowledge graphs.Proven success in addressing content security problems on abusive content, hate speech, and fake content detection is a big plus.Experience in bias detection and prevention, explainable AI is a plus.Good knowledge of Python and hands-on experience with some NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, and Keras.Experience with various public cloud environments and technologies is a plus.Ph.D. in AI/ML/NLP computer science, maths, statistics, computational linguistics, or equivalent experience.LocationThis position is located at our R&D office in Ruoholahti, Helsinki, Finland. We will start interviews immediately when suitable candidates are found, so do not hesitate to send in your application too long!

We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our Creative Group at Smartly and take part in a large-scale integration project between Smartly.io and our latest acquisition Ad-lib.io. In this role you will take ownership of working on the integrations between two large-scale and established products that have already a large customer base. Your work will for example include data migrations, development of both existing and new features, and seeking alignment between the products when it comes to customer identification, asset management and rendering digital advertisements.We are technology agnostic and always aim to choose the best tools for the job. On the backend, our favoured stack is Node.js in combination with TypeScript usually coupled with PostgreSQL.As a Senior Backend Engineer you will...Documenting our services and communicating our offerings to other teams within SmartlyDefining, designing and owning API contracts made for internal and external stakeholdersFocus on well-designed and well-executed software, quality mattersBe a core contributor of our Creative Engineering Group's ambitions and product offeringWork with our stakeholders - be them UX, product, infrastructure or our support function - to ensure we meet customers where they areApply and enhance your soft skills through working closely with your colleagues and our customers What We Are Looking For...Experience in backend development using modern technologies. Experience in building robust, complex and distributed web applicationsInterest towards building large scale integrations, bonus points for experience in this areaWillingness to master modern technologies such as NodeJS, JavaScript, Typescript, Postgres, message brokers like RabbitMQ, AWS and KubernetesPassion to drive best possible technical architecture choices, and be fearless to when facing unknown new challenges Motivation for solving customers problems and delivering value to customers at a fast pace What We Offer You...Our projects are a part of the DNA of our product, which means that every team will have some skin in the game. Your work will have a direct impact on our customers and our business. You will own your work, and we will support you in that ownership. We value work life balance and have a strong culture that we hope all of our Smartlies bring their own flavor to. As a company we provide a competitive salary, option package and a generous package of benefits.What To Expect From Our Recruitment ProcessFirst meeting: we're getting to know each other. Meeting the Team Lead: learn more about your future team.Technical interviews: You will take part in an interactive coding interview with one of our developers followed by a discussion around Systems Design and Architecture. Final meeting: As the final interview we will have a short discussion with our VP of Engineering to learn more about the higher level goals and plans for the Group.Meet Smartly.ioSmartly.io is one of the world’s largest SaaS digital advertising platforms. We help brands better reach audiences, engage creatives and learn what performs best across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Snap, Pinterest, TikTok, and Google.We manage nearly $5B in ad spend and help 700+ brands worldwide. Our leading end-to-end technology and outstanding customer helps brands like Walmart, FanDuel, L’Oreal, Warner Bros. Discovery, Nestle, and Disney/ESPN to better reach audiences, engage creatives and learn what performs best.We offer growth-minded people opportunities to make an impact in a fast-paced, collaborative and inclusive environment built on a culture of trust, transparency, and feedback. You’ll work with a team of 600+ Smartlies, representing 60+ nationalities. We operate in 13 countries across 24 locations.At Smartly.io, you can enjoy the freedom to harmonize work and personal life. As a global, hybrid organization, we are mindful to collaborate in ways that allow everyone, everywhere to be productive and feel included.Join our global team to change the future of digital marketing!Learn more at smartly.io/careers.

In this role you will take ownership of working on the integrations between two large-scale and established products that have already a large customer base. Your work will for example include data migrations, development of both existing and new features, and seeking alignment between the products when it comes to customer identification, asset management and rendering digital advertisements.We are technology agnostic and always aim to choose the best tools for the job. On the backend, our favoured stack is Node.js in combination with TypeScript usually coupled with PostgreSQL.As a Senior Backend Engineer you will...Documenting our services and communicating our offerings to other teams within SmartlyDefining, designing and owning API contracts made for internal and external stakeholdersFocus on well-designed and well-executed software, quality mattersBe a core contributor of our Creative Engineering Group's ambitions and product offeringWork with our stakeholders - be them UX, product, infrastructure or our support function - to ensure we meet customers where they areApply and enhance your soft skills through working closely with your colleagues and our customers What We Are Looking For...Experience in backend development using modern technologies. Experience in building robust, complex and distributed web applicationsInterest towards building large scale integrations, bonus points for experience in this areaWillingness to master modern technologies such as NodeJS, JavaScript, Typescript, Postgres, message brokers like RabbitMQ, AWS and KubernetesPassion to drive best possible technical architecture choices, and be fearless to when facing unknown new challenges Motivation for solving customers problems and delivering value to customers at a fast pace What We Offer You...Our projects are a part of the DNA of our product, which means that every team will have some skin in the game. Your work will have a direct impact on our customers and our business. You will own your work, and we will support you in that ownership. We value work life balance and have a strong culture that we hope all of our Smartlies bring their own flavor to. As a company we provide a competitive salary, option package and a generous package of benefits.What To Expect From Our Recruitment ProcessFirst meeting: we're getting to know each other. Meeting the Team Lead: learn more about your future team.Technical interviews: You will take part in an interactive coding interview with one of our developers followed by a discussion around Systems Design and Architecture. Final meeting: As the final interview we will have a short discussion with our VP of Engineering to learn more about the higher level goals and plans for the Group.Meet Smartly.ioSmartly.io is one of the world’s largest SaaS digital advertising platforms. We help brands better reach audiences, engage creatives and learn what performs best across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Snap, Pinterest, TikTok, and Google.We manage nearly $5B in ad spend and help 700+ brands worldwide. Our leading end-to-end technology and outstanding customer helps brands like Walmart, FanDuel, L’Oreal, Warner Bros. Discovery, Nestle, and Disney/ESPN to better reach audiences, engage creatives and learn what performs best.We offer growth-minded people opportunities to make an impact in a fast-paced, collaborative and inclusive environment built on a culture of trust, transparency, and feedback. You’ll work with a team of 600+ Smartlies, representing 60+ nationalities. We operate in 13 countries across 24 locations.At Smartly.io, you can enjoy the freedom to harmonize work and personal life. As a global, hybrid organization, we are mindful to collaborate in ways that allow everyone, everywhere to be productive and feel included.Join our global team to change the future of digital marketing!Learn more at smartly.io/careers.

We help brands better reach audiences, engage creatives and learn what performs best across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Snap, Pinterest, TikTok, and Google.We manage nearly $5B in ad spend and help 700+ brands worldwide. Our leading end-to-end technology and outstanding customer helps brands like Walmart, FanDuel, L’Oreal, Warner Bros. Discovery, Nestle, and Disney/ESPN to better reach audiences, engage creatives and learn what performs best.We offer growth-minded people opportunities to make an impact in a fast-paced, collaborative and inclusive environment built on a culture of trust, transparency, and feedback. You’ll work with a team of 600+ Smartlies, representing 60+ nationalities. We operate in 13 countries across 24 locations.At Smartly.io, you can enjoy the freedom to harmonize work and personal life. As a global, hybrid organization, we are mindful to collaborate in ways that allow everyone, everywhere to be productive and feel included.Join our global team to change the future of digital marketing!Learn more at smartly.io/careers.

We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our Creative Group at Smartly and take part in a large-scale integration project between Smartly.io and our latest acquisition Ad-lib.io. In this role you will take ownership of working on the integrations between two large-scale and established products that have already a large customer base. Your work will for example include data migrations, development of both existing and new features, and seeking alignment between the products when it comes to customer identification, asset management and rendering digital advertisements.We are technology agnostic and always aim to choose the best tools for the job. On the backend, our favoured stack is Node.js in combination with TypeScript usually coupled with PostgreSQL.As a Senior Backend Engineer you will...Documenting our services and communicating our offerings to other teams within SmartlyDefining, designing and owning API contracts made for internal and external stakeholdersFocus on well-designed and well-executed software, quality mattersBe a core contributor of our Creative Engineering Group's ambitions and product offeringWork with our stakeholders - be them UX, product, infrastructure or our support function - to ensure we meet customers where they areApply and enhance your soft skills through working closely with your colleagues and our customers What We Are Looking For...Experience in backend development using modern technologies. Experience in building robust, complex and distributed web applicationsInterest towards building large scale integrations, bonus points for experience in this areaWillingness to master modern technologies such as NodeJS, JavaScript, Typescript, Postgres, message brokers like RabbitMQ, AWS and KubernetesPassion to drive best possible technical architecture choices, and be fearless to when facing unknown new challenges Motivation for solving customers problems and delivering value to customers at a fast pace What We Offer You...Our projects are a part of the DNA of our product, which means that every team will have some skin in the game. Your work will have a direct impact on our customers and our business. You will own your work, and we will support you in that ownership. We value work life balance and have a strong culture that we hope all of our Smartlies bring their own flavor to. As a company we provide a competitive salary, option package and a generous package of benefits.What To Expect From Our Recruitment ProcessFirst meeting: we're getting to know each other. We are looking for Salesforce developers who are motivated by working on software that has a measurable impact on business. You get to work directly with our clients in highly autonomous teams where software, design, and marketing come together.About Columbia RoadColumbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists.Currently, we have over 20 nationalities working in the company and the official language is English. Our company spirit is one of a true start-up, but with a twist of hard-core experience. We believe in giving a lot of responsibility and freedom to our employees. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road has grown from 0 to over 140 exceptionally talented people in 6 years and in two countries. We are proud of the high customer satisfaction we have achieved as a result of focusing on people and creating concrete, measurable business impact for our clients every day.Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score. Diversity, equity and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.Job DescriptionWe are now recruiting in Tampere for the first time ever, and we have ambitious business goals in the area (we always do). As a Salesforce developer in Columbia Road’s Tampere team, you will be working in a high-impact role in the core of our clients’ businesses. You’ll have an integral role in building the Tampere team, your contribution will have a significant influence on our local operations.As a consultant at Columbia Road, you will be working in the core of our clients’ businesses; advising, designing and implementing the tech needed to drive the business forward. This is a great opportunity for you if you are looking to become an expert within the area of digital sales and expand your technical skills and know-how within – and beyond if you like, – the Salesforce ecosystem.Your job is to create business impact by helping our clients utilise the capabilities of the Salesforce ecosystem to the fullest. You automate business processes and develop and enhance existing solutions that are at the forefront of our clients business. You strive to be a full-stack Salesforce developer, even though your current skills might lean more towards backend or frontend development. You know the core Salesforce setup and configuration capabilities well enough to evaluate when custom development is really needed.Columbia Road's focus on digital sales means that we are tackling a large variety of projects. These range from Experience Cloud and customer 360 data platform projects to Sales and Service Clouds, CPQ and various integrations, where the Salesforce ecosystem is a key enabler. For a few concrete examples of our relevant cases, take a look at the Framery case of a new partner sales and collaboration channel and full business platform build project for Valokuitunen.We work as diverse teams of digital sales experts, tailored to each project. In most of your projects, you will get to work closely with business designers defining which processes to automate and UI/UX designers to build world-class user and customer-facing experiences. As we believe that best results arise from employee freedom, all teams have wide latitude to choose the best tools and ways of working for themselves. We expect you to be mostly into the Salesforce ecosystem while we hope that you want to grow into a Roadie who can recognise where other solutions might be a better fit.At Columbia Road, we approach projects from a tech agnostic perspective, choosing the technologies that best suit our clients' needs. Depending on your career goals, you can continue deepening your skillset with Salesforce or expand your know-how to other programming languages, technologies, and platforms as well. We see this as a great opportunity for professional growth and are looking for colleagues who also value this. The more experience you have, the more you'll be able to take responsibility for your client projects and help other Roadies grow as well.As our Tampere team is still fairly new, an interest in contributing to areas such as recruitment, sales, supporting others and building the Columbia Road culture is highly valued.Professional Benefits For YouA high-impact role as a trusted advisor to important stakeholders - your contribution will create a significant impact on the client’s and Columbia Road’s successOpportunity to have an integral part in our Tampere operationsParticipating in account management and framing our sales offering, should you be interestedWorking directly with the client - no middle management involvedA clear focus on digital sales, in both B2C and B2BYou'll have the best people to work with and learn from in a truly flat organisationA diverse and inclusive workplaceRequirementsUnderstanding of Salesforce’s setup and configuration capabilities and having hands-on experience in one or more of Salesforce clouds such as Sales, Service or Experience CloudHighly skilled in APEX and SOQL. Know-how in Lightning web components, in addition, is considered a great asset. Great communication and problem-solving skills and an analytical mindsetFamiliarity with modern web-programming languages is considered a plus (such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX or similar other technologies)Past experience in consulting, digital commerce or around sales and marketing processes is valued but not requiredYou are authorized to work in Finland or Sweden. Unfortunately, we are currently not able to support with relocationRecruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews.When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!BenefitsAs a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Flexible remote working and a shared office with Futurice in Tampella + brick-n-mortar office in downtown HelsinkiEven in a hybrid work environment, we create new ways to interact with other Roadies; exclusive exercise and outdoor activities and remote workspaces for individual teams are a few examples of this.Lunch benefitPhone benefitPick the laptop and phone of your choosingHealth care & service, including dental and mental healthChildcare services when your child falls illInsurance for travel and free-timeRecurring training & learning sessionsWellness and personal development (tools, events, etc.) reimbursementWeekly breakfasts & healthy daily refreshmentsSports, culture & massage vouchersBike benefitCompany-wide excursion tripsOption to have housing as a part of total compensation (tax-deductible)Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time

Ready to start the next chapter in your career journey? You’re in the right place. We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Welcome home.We're looking for Tech Lead/ArchitectTech Lead's / Architects at Futurice are generalists working across industries to help clients solve their important challenges in business and technology. They work with digital services, software development and improving how digital is done in big organizations. They have a wide understanding of technology and a toolset of modern frameworks and methodologies. Tech Lead's/Architects often have years of experience in software development but have extended the scope of problems to tackle as they also want to see the impact being made to organizational issues. Here are some examples of our expertise:DevOps & Cloud architectureSolid experience with AWS, Google Cloud and/or Microsoft AzureDesigning for Single Cloud provider or Hybrid Cloud scenariosDeveloping complex scenarios using cloud agnostic stacksSecurity architectureFacilitating Threat Modeling & Risk Management workshopsSecurity Auditing and recommending code pipeline best practicesAI & Data architectureBuilding Data Lake and Data Warehousing solutions in the CloudAnalytics, Visualizations and Business Intelligence systems (e.g. Splunk, Kibana, PowerBI, QlikView, QuickSight, Data Studio, etc)AI/Machine Learning model creation and training (e.g. Tensorflow, Apache MXNet)Additionally, you will take a significant role in shaping the architecture team and contributing to our company thought leadership efforts. Due to the exploratory nature of this role, you will also assist in account management and sales related activities.Are you our new colleague?You have a broad knowledge of tools, frameworks and technologies related to designing, implementing, deploying and hosting software services.Solid experience in at least one of the following Architecture domains: DevOps & Cloud, Security and/or Data & AIStrong expertise in agile software development and methods (e.g. Scrum, Kanban).You have experience in designing and implementing modern REST-based APIs, using e.g. Java, Scala, or Node.js.You have a good understanding of both relational databases as well as no-SQL databases.Good leadership skills in achieving momentum, action and resultsAbility to ask the right questions and drive troubleshooting with expertsThought leader and influencer: public speaking, tech articles, etc.Willingness to take a step in the abstraction level to solve organizational issues and drive towards results in big projects.Ability to work in diverse work cultures and comfortable with nonhierarchical organizations.Fluent English is required, Finnish skills is a plus.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.

We are looking for consultants who have specialised in web analytics, data-driven marketing and have a growth hacking mindset. You will have an important role in helping our customers grow their business.Who We AreColumbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists.Currently, we have over 20 nationalities working in the company and the official language is English. Our company spirit is one of a true start-up, but with a twist of hard-core experience. We believe in giving a lot of responsibility and freedom to our employees. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road has grown from 0 to over 140 exceptionally talented people in 6 years and in two countries. We are proud of the high customer satisfaction we have achieved as a result of focusing on people and creating concrete, measurable business impact for our clients every day.Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.The Job & What You’d Be Working OnAs a web analytics consultant, you’ll be building sustainable digital sales ecommerce & channel strategies for our customers and challenging their thinking. You are able to analyse root causes of their current state and propose improvements; this means also understanding and analysing their technology environment, processes, organisation and governance models. You will be in a key role in helping our customers grow their business.You understand digital business on all levels; from analytics and technology stack to all touchpoints along the customer journey. Besides presenting the outcomes of your analysis to clients, you are using these insights to continuously test hypotheses and tactics with real customers and optimising business operations.RequirementsSkills and experience we expect you to have:Your toolbox includes frameworks and methods that help to gather data, structure analysis, develop impactful insights, and communicate clear and actionable recommendationsHands-on implementation and operational experience in web analytics (e.g. Google Analytics, Matomo, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and tag management (e.g. Google Tag Manager, Tealium)Hands-on implementation and operational experience in e.g., data visualisation tools, A/B-testing, communicating data insights, digital marketing and customer acquisitionAt least a basic understanding of front-end development (HTML, JavaScript, and CSS)Scripting skills (e.g. Python), or experience in technical SEO are considered a plusAbility to communicate clearly about complex issues to C Suite level audiences as well as to technical teamsAnalytical mindset, ability to see what's outside of the boxLanguages: professional proficiency in English and limited working proficiency in FinnishYou’ll be working as a team together with our technology and design consultants. When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!BenefitsA community-led organization with a high level of autonomy As a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Recurring training and learning sessions to support your professional growthA diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplaceOffices in downtown Helsinki (with gym and pool) and TamperePick the laptop, phone, and digital tools of your choosingExtensive health care services, including dental and mental healthInsurance for travel and free-timeLunch benefitPhone benefitWeekly breakfasts and healthy daily refreshmentsFlexible vouchers for sports, culture, commuting, and massageOption to have housing as a part of total compensationOption to have a bicycle salary alternative as a part of total compensationRecurring Roadie-ideated events and activitiesChildcare services when your child falls illCompensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time

Ready to start the next chapter in your career journey? You’re in the right place. We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Welcome home.We're looking for Tech Lead/ArchitectTech Lead's / Architects at Futurice are generalists working across industries to help clients solve their important challenges in business and technology. They work with digital services, software development and improving how digital is done in big organizations. Tech Lead's/Architects often have years of experience in software development but have extended the scope of problems to tackle as they also want to see the impact being made to organizational issues. Here are some examples of our expertise:DevOps & Cloud architectureSolid experience with AWS, Google Cloud and/or Microsoft AzureDesigning for Single Cloud provider or Hybrid Cloud scenariosDeveloping complex scenarios using cloud agnostic stacksSecurity architectureFacilitating Threat Modeling & Risk Management workshopsSecurity Auditing and recommending code pipeline best practicesAI & Data architectureBuilding Data Lake and Data Warehousing solutions in the CloudAnalytics, Visualizations and Business Intelligence systems (e.g. Splunk, Kibana, PowerBI, QlikView, QuickSight, Data Studio, etc)AI/Machine Learning model creation and training (e.g. Tensorflow, Apache MXNet)Additionally, you will take a significant role in shaping the architecture team and contributing to our company thought leadership efforts. Due to the exploratory nature of this role, you will also assist in account management and sales related activities.Are you our new colleague?You have a broad knowledge of tools, frameworks and technologies related to designing, implementing, deploying and hosting software services.Solid experience in at least one of the following Architecture domains: DevOps & Cloud, Security and/or Data & AIStrong expertise in agile software development and methods (e.g. Scrum, Kanban).You have experience in designing and implementing modern REST-based APIs, using e.g. Java, Scala, or Node.js.You have a good understanding of both relational databases as well as no-SQL databases.Good leadership skills in achieving momentum, action and resultsAbility to ask the right questions and drive troubleshooting with expertsThought leader and influencer: public speaking, tech articles, etc.Willingness to take a step in the abstraction level to solve organizational issues and drive towards results in big projects.Ability to work in diverse work cultures and comfortable with nonhierarchical organizations.Fluent English is required, Finnish skills is a plus.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.

As a marketing automation consultant, you'll be working on planning and executing successful marketing automation activities, such as lead acquisition, nurturing, upselling, and customer activation. Who We AreColumbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists.Currently, we have over 20 nationalities working in the company and the official language is English. Our company spirit is one of a true start-up, but with a twist of hard-core experience. We believe in giving a lot of responsibility and freedom to our employees. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road has grown from 0 to over 140 exceptionally talented people in 6 years and in two countries. We are proud of the high customer satisfaction we have achieved as a result of focusing on people and creating concrete, measurable business impact for our clients every day.Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score. Diversity, equity and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.Job DescriptionWe are now recruiting in Tampere for the first time ever, and we have ambitious business goals in the area (we always do). As a marketing automation consultant in Columbia Road’s Tampere team, you will be working in a high-impact role in the core of our clients’ businesses. You’ll have an integral role in building the Tampere team, your contribution will have a significant influence on our local operations.At Columbia Road, we believe that marketing and sales should be a joint effort. Marketing is not an add-on, it’s at the core of digital sales. Digital marketers should be working right there with the team developing digital sales. We’re committed to making a change in our field.We are looking for marketing automation consultants who have an innovative mindset towards generating growth. You will be in a key role in helping our customers grow their business.As a marketing automation consultant, you are used to planning and executing successful marketing automation activities, such as lead acquisition, nurturing, upselling, and customer activation.We expect you to have extensive hands-on experience from implementing and operating one or more marketing automation tools, and to have an understanding of customer journeys and nurturing campaigns.You are familiar with customer data analytics operations and are able to derive business insights from complex data, while endlessly driving to improve the customer experience at all stages of the customer journey.By nature, you are analytical and like to solve problems. You are able to bring clarity to uncertain and chaotic situations. You are ambitious and results-oriented in everything you do, but you like to have fun as well.In order to be successful in this role, we require you to have professional proficiency in written and spoken Finnish and English. In this job, you may need to write and manage content for Finnish speaking audiences.As our Tampere team is still fairly new, an interest in contributing to areas such as recruitment, sales, supporting others and building the Columbia Road culture is highly valued.Professional Benefits For YouA high-impact role as a trusted advisor to important stakeholders - your contribution will create a significant impact on the client’s and Columbia Road’s successOpportunity to have an integral part in our Tampere operationsParticipating in account management and framing our sales offering, should you be interestedWorking directly with the client - no middle management involvedA clear focus on digital sales, in both B2C and B2BYou'll have the best people to work with and learn from in a truly flat organisationA diverse and inclusive workplaceRequirementsSkills and experience we expect you to have:Analytical and curious mindset, ability to see outside the boxAbility to quickly identify business challenges and opportunities, and create an actionable plan for solving themAbility to communicate clearly about complex issues to C Suite level audiences as well as to technical teamsHands-on implementation and operational experience in Marketing Automation platforms, for example, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Hubspot, Pardot, Marketo, Eloqua, Exponea/Bloomreach, and/or Customer.ioUtilising customer data from various sources, e.g. CRMs, CDPs, and/or DMPsInterest in web technologies and understanding also the technical side of toolsLanguages: working proficiency Finnish and EnglishAdditionally, we highly value any relevant additional skills, such as:CRM tools, e.g. Salesforce, HubSpot, Pipedrive, and/or MS DynamicsDigital advertising, e.g. Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, and/or AdformSEO, content and technicalTag management, e.g. Google Tag ManagerCRO and/or A/B testingFront-end development, e.g. HTML, CSS and/or JavaScriptService-, UX-, and/or graphic designCopywritingSales developmentMake sure you showcase your experience and knowledge as clearly as possible in your application, resume, and possible other attachments. We value examples and results from previous projects, and we'd love to know what concrete tools you used to get those results.Recruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews.When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!BenefitsAs a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Flexible remote working and a shared office with Futurice in Tampella + brick-n-mortar office in downtown HelsinkiEven in a hybrid work environment, we create new ways to interact with other Roadies; exclusive exercise and outdoor activities and remote workspaces for individual teams are a few examples of this.Lunch benefitPhone benefitPick the laptop and phone of your choosingHealth care & service, including dental and mental healthChildcare services when your child falls illInsurance for travel and free-timeRecurring training & learning sessionsWellness and personal development (tools, events, etc.) reimbursementWeekly breakfasts & healthy daily refreshmentsSports, culture & massage vouchersBike benefitCompany-wide excursion tripsOption to have housing as a part of total compensation (tax-deductible) Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time

Here are some examples of our expertise:DevOps & Cloud architectureSolid experience with AWS, Google Cloud and/or Microsoft AzureDesigning for Single Cloud provider or Hybrid Cloud scenariosDeveloping complex scenarios using cloud agnostic stacksSecurity architectureFacilitating Threat Modeling & Risk Management workshopsSecurity Auditing and recommending code pipeline best practicesAI & Data architectureBuilding Data Lake and Data Warehousing solutions in the CloudAnalytics, Visualizations and Business Intelligence systems (e.g. Splunk, Kibana, PowerBI, QlikView, QuickSight, Data Studio, etc)AI/Machine Learning model creation and training (e.g. Tensorflow, Apache MXNet)Additionally, you will take a significant role in shaping the architecture team and contributing to our company thought leadership efforts. Due to the exploratory nature of this role, you will also assist in account management and sales related activities.Are you our new colleague?You have a broad knowledge of tools, frameworks and technologies related to designing, implementing, deploying and hosting software services.Solid experience in at least one of the following Architecture domains: DevOps & Cloud, Security and/or Data & AIStrong expertise in agile software development and methods (e.g. Scrum, Kanban).You have experience in designing and implementing modern REST-based APIs, using e.g. Java, Scala, or Node.js.You have a good understanding of both relational databases as well as no-SQL databases.Good leadership skills in achieving momentum, action and resultsAbility to ask the right questions and drive troubleshooting with expertsThought leader and influencer: public speaking, tech articles, etc.Willingness to take a step in the abstraction level to solve organizational issues and drive towards results in big projects.Ability to work in diverse work cultures and comfortable with nonhierarchical organizations.Fluent English is required, Finnish skills is a plus.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.

Are you an ambitious Growth Marketing Manager who thrives in a B2B environment? Are you passionate about experimentation, driving engagement, and building high-quality sales pipelines?At Valohai, our mission is to free machine learning teams from repetitive, mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on building models and benefiting humankind with their discoveries. We're seeking a B2B Growth Marketing Manager to take ownership, be hands-on, and help expand our reach within the industry.About the role:As a B2B Growth Marketing Manager at Valohai, you will systematically experiment with different channels and messaging to drive engagement, convert leads into a high-quality sales pipeline, and work closely with the sales team to develop processes and qualification criteria to keep growth and sales aligned.You will own the growth process from start to finish and be excited about being in the driver's seat, showcasing your progress to the team.Responsibilities:Plan and execute growth experiments in a B2B environmentWrite compelling marketing copyExecute paid marketing campaigns (LinkedIn, Google Ads)Build marketing collateral (web, email, PDF)Manage CRMs, marketing automation, and reporting (HubSpot)Ideal skills:Solid track record of planning and executing growth experimentsExperience with writing marketing copyExperience with executing paid marketing campaigns (LinkedIn, Google Ads)Experience with building marketing collateral (web, email, PDF)Experience with CRMs, marketing automation, and reporting (HubSpot)Technical skills are appreciated (such as HTML, CSS, Javascript, SQL)Design skills are appreciatedAt Valohai, we value our employees and understand the importance of offering a great work environment. As a member of our team, you'll enjoy a competitive salary and a stock option package.You'll have the option of working at our Helsinki and Turku offices.The hiring process:The process is quick and consists of a few interviews with different members of our team. Applications are evaluated on an ongoing basis, and the position will be filled as soon as a matching candidate is found.If you're a self-motivated individual with a passion for driving growth in the B2B sector, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and take the first step towards joining our dynamic and exciting team at Valohai.

Valohai is looking for an experienced and motivated software developer to join our development team. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on a collaborative project under the guidance of our Head of Product, helping to develop and implement new features for our MLOps platform.Our platform helps automate the deployment and management of machine learning models, and we are looking for someone excited to be a part of this project.The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experiences:⭐️ Strong knowledge of Python⭐️ Bonus points for experience with Typescript and ReactAs a software developer, you will be responsible for:⭐️ Building and maintaining the platform as part of a project team⭐️ Collaborating with team members, including the Head of Product, to further develop and ensure the smooth operation of our platform.We are currently prioritizing candidates from Turku & Helsinki or those willing to relocate, as our core development team is in Finland.Valohai is not just any ordinary workplace. It's a dynamic and exciting environment where you can thrive professionally and personally. We value our employees and understand the importance of offering attractive compensation and benefits.As a member of our team, you'll enjoy a competitive salary and a stock option package. You'll have the option of working remotely (nearly all the time anyway) from home or your local co-working space, or at our Turku and Helsinki offices if you feel like that instead.If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for technology and a desire to work on cutting-edge projects as part of a team, we would love to hear from you.
