Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.We are looking for an Embedded Software Developer to join our team at ABB Oy, Drives Division in Helsinki (Pitäjänmäki) or Tampere. You will be a member of the Scrum team that develops and implements embedded software for the ACS880 industrial variable frequency drives product family. We offer you a position in a global working environment with a high team spirit and challenging and varying work assignments. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in SW development by working with other experts in large scale SW organization and develop into Principal Engineer, Software Architect, Scrum Master, or Product Owner.Our organization is strongly committed to agile working methods. Development and work planning is done in Scrum teams. The local software department consists of around 50 developers, and we co-operate globally with teams in China, India and Switzerland. Continuous integration, automated testing and modern tools are key elements for our daily work.We offer for you:A challenging position in an international and team spirited working environment in large scale embedded SW project with modern development toolsThe opportunity for personal development in the form of trainings and daily collaboration with other expertsPossibility to see your code distributing around the world in volume products and build personal expertise in the area of embedded software developmentBenefits we offer at the moment include e.g. an annual performance bonus, a flexible working model, subsidized lunch, development & training, employee share ownership program, benefits for families with children, sports, massage and cultural benefits and many hobby clubs.This position reports toDesign ManagerYour responsibilitiesDeveloping and implementing embedded software for grid-connected converters and/or AC motor drives as a member of Scrum teamNew SW feature development for existing and new products together with other SW and HW teamsDeveloping SW frameworks, build environments, tools and architecture for optimizing efficient developmentProviding professional technical support for existing products and solving challenging technical problems in embedded system domainQuality assurance in all phases of development work including unit testing and feature testing activitiesYour backgroundB. Sc. or M.Sc. in software engineering, automation or electrical engineeringExperience in C and C++ software developmentExperience working with real-time embedded systemsThe knowledge of modern software development tools and methods (e.g. GIT, Microsoft Azure DevOps, unit testing, continuous integration)Willingness to understand customer needs and applications where the end product is usedExcellent written and spoken communication skills in EnglishOpen-minded attitude for challenges and learning new and good cooperation and team working skillsIdeally, you have also knowledge of Python, experience on agile ways of working, knowledge of electronics and/or power convertersMore about usABB System Drives is a global supplier of high-power, high-performance drives, drive systems and packages for industrial processes and large infrastructure applications. With our industry leading technology and global support, we help our customers, partners and equipment manufacturers with asset reliability, performance improvement and energy efficiency in mission critical applications. Our people and culture are the foundation of our success. We all together make the difference for our customers every day.In Finland, ABB has about 5000 employees, making it one of the biggest industrial employers in the country. ABB Finland serves its customers in over 20 locations and has production sites in Helsinki, Vaasa, Porvoo and Hamina. As a global company, we’re also able to offer international job opportunities.If you have questions, contact Design Manager Janne O. Korhonen, tel. +358 50 332 4002.Additional information about ABB Drives YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_uJr7mTJ7KAInterested in joining the crew? Please apply for the position by May 28, 2023. We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.Work model: hybrid85415097

Are you interested in remote sensing and looking for a new job opportunity in the field? Would you like to develop innovative technology with superb colleagues who are top experts in their field? Do you want to build an excellent science career and work at the interface of the academy and industry? VTT might be just the place for you. VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning, and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2200 brilliant minds focuses on creating impact through science-based innovation. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra .We are now looking for a Digital Image Analysis specialist to join our Remote Sensing research team in EspooAs a Senior Scientist, Digital Image Analyst you are focusing on analyzing Earth Observation and other remotely sensed image data. Your key goals are developing methodologies for near-real-time data analysis of satellite remotely sensed data, including hyperspectral data. The position is in Espoo.Our Remote Sensing team conducts data analysis of remotely sensed data, driving innovative solutions for assessing and monitoring natural resources, object detection, semantic segmentation, and other application areas. You will be at the forefront of cutting-edge technologies, including time series analysis, near-real-time data processing, AI-based solutions, and multi-source data fusion. As a member of our team, you will collaborate with world-renowned research institutes, universities, and companies, and have the opportunity to contribute to impactful areas such as security, national defense, and natural resource monitoring.As a Senior Scientist, you will:Work as a data scientist in analyzing EO data and other remotely sensed data.Manage research and commercial projects, write, and contribute to grant proposals and commercial project tenders. Develop and implement novel AI-based analysis methods to interpret remotely sensed data.Document the results (in English) and communicate with customers and other stakeholders.Who we are looking for:We expect that you haveAt least two years of working experience with digital image analysisDeep understanding of 2D/3D object recognition, image segmentation, motion detection, or video tracking methodsStrong experience in AI/machine learning methods including classification and/or regression modellingBasic knowledge of GIS/spatial analysis, and statisticsGood cooperation and networking skills.At least an MSc degree in information sciences or another suitable discipline.Fluent in written and oral communication in English.Hands-on experience with methods like R-CNN, SSD, and YOLO will be regarded as plus.As a person, we hope that you are:Self-driven and excited to learn new things and to strengthen your skills in the field of remote sensing.You find it interesting to be part of the development of state-of-the-art remote sensing analysis in our international projects that aim for global markets.With VTT, you’ll enjoy:Visionary work in technology. We offer positions at the cutting-edge of technology and engineering, from next-generation microelectronics and quantum technology to automation and robotics, energy systems, and more. Our research agenda is dedicated to creating sustainable growth by solving systemic and technological challenges, so your work will go towards creating a real, positive impact. Read more about our strategy – the path of exponential hope .Fascinating projects, excellent research environment. Our researchers get to work on a combination of cutting-edge academic research and applied customer projects locally and internationally. At VTT, you'll have state-of-the-art research facilities, such as Micronova, the Finnish research infrastructure for micro-, nano-, and quantum technologies. Great career opportunities, superb colleagues. At VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us for over ten years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. Collaborating in a cross-disciplinary community with superb colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun. Read more about our organisational culture as the builder of the world's most meaningful place to work.Support for your well-being. Our people are our main asset, so we take good care of them. We aim to nurture excellent team spirit and leadership and offer versatile well-being services to enable a good work-life balance. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays, we offer exercise and culture benefits, hobby clubs, and voluntary well-being services such as meditation and cognitive ergonomics training.Apply now and join our community of brilliant minds!Please send your CV and application with your salary request via our recruitment system as soon as possible but at the latest by 28 May 2023. We will process applications as they come in and fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate. A security clearance procedure may be conducted during the recruitment process.Interested and want to know more?For further information, please contact Research Team Leader Jussi Peuhkurinen (jussi.peuhkurinen@vtt.fi)We look forward to hearing from you!VTTVTT is a visionary research, development and innovation partner. We drive sustainable growth and tackle the biggest global challenges of our time and turn them into growth opportunities. We go beyond the obvious to help the society and companies to grow through technological innovations. We have 80 years of experience of top-level research and science-based results. VTT is at the sweet spot where innovation and business come together.VTT – beyond the obvious.Location: Tekniikantie 1, Espoo

Are you interested in connectivity and defense and looking for a new job opportunity in the field? Would you like to develop innovative technology with superb colleagues who are top experts in their field? Do you want to build an excellent science career and work at the interface of academy and industry? VTT might be just the place for you.VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning, and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2200 brilliant minds focuses on creating impact through science-based innovation. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra .We are now looking for a (Senior) Research Scientist to join our research team. Our team, Connectivity Services and Solutions, concentrates on research and development in networking concepts and solutions for future 5G-A and 6G networks and on novel services over mobile networks. Currently, we are strengthening our team with ambitious and results oriented researchers in the security and defense networking area.As a (Senior) Research Scientist, you are focusing on connectivity solutions, especially for 5G/6G networks in security and defense areas and for connectivity solutions for situational awareness. In addition to mobile networks, you will be working on Jointly funded and customer projects in various areas, e.g., in Air Traffic controlling, Radar solutions, Situational awareness, Datalink verifications and Tactical networks.The role will involve working across various research and development efforts with various customers or jointly funded projects. The role may include project management and later project coordination and preparation tasks. You are curious and willing to accept new challenges. To succeed in this position, you should be a team player who is willing to learn new things. The role gives you possibilities to create your own expertise areas and to report your results to the research community.Who we are looking for:You hold a M.Sc. or D.Sc./Ph.D. degree in telecommunications or computer science and engineering. You have experience in working with wireless network technologies, including, for example, 5G, LTE, 6G, Wi-Fi, tactical radios, mesh network technologies, or non-terrestrial networks and satellite communications. You have solid understanding and experience of project work. You are dedicated to rigorous and innovative scientific work and have some experience in publishing your research in international peer-reviewed journals or conferences. You look forward to working in an international context, together with industrial companies, defense forces and research organizations as well as to developing your capabilities towards acting as a project manager in industrial and/or research collaborations. Mandatory spoken and written fluency of Finnish and English. Additionally, you will benefit from the following:Relevant work experience from the target area We would appreciate it if you have good programming (e.g., C/C++, Python) and software development skills. Understanding of the operation and optimization (e.g., using ML/AI) of wireless and end-to-end communication systems, including protocols and key applications, for example, TCP/IP, IoT, video streaming, and edge/cloud computing. We also appreciate prior experience from system modelling, algorithm design, and use of simulation tools such as Matlab, ns-3 and STK. As a person, we hope that you are:A fast learner, who can work in a flexible and independent manner and collaborate with colleagues across different fields of science and technology. We appreciate curiosity, passion, and the ability to take a long-term perspective and find beyond-the-obvious solutions. A problem-solver, able to work autonomously in an open research environment. You enjoy coming up with your own innovative solutions to problems and designing a methodology to test and compare them with the prior art. With VTT, you’ll enjoy:Visionary work in technology. We offer positions at the cutting-edge of technology and engineering, from next-generation microelectronics and quantum technology to automation and robotics, energy systems, and more. Our research agenda is dedicated to creating sustainable growth by solving systemic and technological challenges, so your work will go towards creating a real, positive impact. Read more about our strategy – the path of exponential hope .Fascinating projects, excellent research environment. Our researchers get to work on a combination of cutting-edge academic research and applied customer projects locally and internationally. At VTT, you'll have state-of-the-art research facilities, such as Micronova, the Finnish research infrastructure for micro-, nano-, and quantum technologies. Great career opportunities, superb colleagues. At VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us for over ten years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. Collaborating in a cross-disciplinary community with superb colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun. Read more about our organisational culture as the builder of the world's most meaningful place to work.Support for your well-being. Our people are our main asset, so we take good care of them. We aim to nurture excellent team spirit and leadership and offer versatile well-being services to enable a good work-life balance. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays, we offer exercise and culture benefits, hobby clubs, and voluntary well-being services such as meditation and cognitive ergonomics training.Apply now and join our community of brilliant minds!Please send your CV and application with your salary request via our recruitment system as soon as possible but at the latest by 28 May 2023. We will process applications as they come in and fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate. A security clearance procedure may be conducted during the recruitment process.Interested and want to know more?For further information, please contact Research Team Leader Kari Heiska, +358407742612, kari.heiska@vtt.fi on Monday 22.5. from 14-15 and on Friday 26.5. on 10-11.We look forward to hearing from you!Location: Espoo, Oulu or TampereVTTVTT is a visionary research, development and innovation partner. Are you interested in connectivity and defense and looking for a new job opportunity in the field? Would you like to develop innovative technology with superb colleagues who are top experts in their field? Do you want to build an excellent science career and work at the interface of academy and industry? VTT might be just the place for you.VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning, and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2200 brilliant minds focuses on creating impact through science-based innovation. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra .We are now looking for a (Senior) Research Scientist to join our research team. Our team, Connectivity Services and Solutions, concentrates on research and development in networking concepts and solutions for future 5G-A and 6G networks and on novel services over mobile networks. Currently, we are strengthening our team with ambitious and results oriented researchers in the security and defense networking area.As a (Senior) Research Scientist, you are focusing on connectivity solutions, especially for 5G/6G networks in security and defense areas and for connectivity solutions for situational awareness. In addition to mobile networks, you will be working on Jointly funded and customer projects in various areas, e.g., in Air Traffic controlling, Radar solutions, Situational awareness, Datalink verifications and Tactical networks.The role will involve working across various research and development efforts with various customers or jointly funded projects. The role may include project management and later project coordination and preparation tasks. You are curious and willing to accept new challenges. To succeed in this position, you should be a team player who is willing to learn new things. The role gives you possibilities to create your own expertise areas and to report your results to the research community.Who we are looking for:You hold a M.Sc. or D.Sc./Ph.D. degree in telecommunications or computer science and engineering. You have experience in working with wireless network technologies, including, for example, 5G, LTE, 6G, Wi-Fi, tactical radios, mesh network technologies, or non-terrestrial networks and satellite communications. You have solid understanding and experience of project work. You are dedicated to rigorous and innovative scientific work and have some experience in publishing your research in international peer-reviewed journals or conferences. You look forward to working in an international context, together with industrial companies, defense forces and research organizations as well as to developing your capabilities towards acting as a project manager in industrial and/or research collaborations. Mandatory spoken and written fluency of Finnish and English. Additionally, you will benefit from the following:Relevant work experience from the target area We would appreciate it if you have good programming (e.g., C/C++, Python) and software development skills. Understanding of the operation and optimization (e.g., using ML/AI) of wireless and end-to-end communication systems, including protocols and key applications, for example, TCP/IP, IoT, video streaming, and edge/cloud computing. We also appreciate prior experience from system modelling, algorithm design, and use of simulation tools such as Matlab, ns-3 and STK.
